text: Sir John Trott, 1st Baronet (ca. 1615 - 14 July 1672) of Laverstoke, Hampshire was an English politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1660 to 1672. He was the only son of John Trott, a haberdasher of London and Laverstoke and educated at Clare College, Cambridge.History of Parliament Online - Trott John In 1660 Trott was elected Member of Parliament for Andover in the Convention Parliament. He was created a baronet, of Leverstoke in the County of Southampton, on 12 October 1660.John Burke, John Bernard Burke A genealogical and heraldic history of the extinct and dormant baronetcies In 1661 he was re- elected MP for Andover in the Cavalier Parliament and sat until his death. He died in 1672 and was buried in Laverstoke. He had married Elizabeth Wright, daughter of Sir Edmund Wright, Lord Mayor of London in 1640. There was no male heir and the baronetcy thus became extinct. Their daughter Catherine, who had married Sir Hugh Stukeley, 2nd Baronet of Hinton, inherited his Laverstoke estate. ==References== Category:1615 births Category:1672 deaths Category:Alumni of Clare College, Cambridge Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of England Category:English MPs 1660 Category:English MPs 1661–1679 Category:Deputy Lieutenants of Hampshire
title: Sir John Trott, 1st Baronet
